hits.text_i: Plagiarism detection is a crucial concern in the education sector, especially within academic writing.
hits.text_j: Plagiarism detection is an essential concern in the education field, particularly in academic writing.

hits.text_i: Educational institutions require fair methods to evaluate work, ensuring students are assessed based on their own ideas rather than copied content.
hits.text_j: Schools require fair methods to verify work so that students are assessed on their own ideas rather than copied content.

hits.text_i: Most existing detection tools primarily depend on word-level text matching, which is effective for direct copying but often fails with paraphrased or rewritten text.
hits.text_j: Most contemporary detection tools primarily depend on word-level text matching, which works for direct copying but often misses paraphrased or rewritten text.

hits.text_i: With the growing use of AI-based writing and paraphrasing tools, traditional plagiarism detection techniques that focus on surface-level text matching are becoming inadequate, as rephrased content can easily elude them.
hits.text_j: With the widespread adoption of AI-based writing and paraphrasing tools, traditional plagiarism detection methods that rely on surface-level text matching are becoming insufficient, as rephrased content can easily evade them.

hits.text_i: Thus, it's essential to develop systems capable of identifying semantic similarity between texts, as they can detect when texts convey the same ideas.
hits.text_j: Therefore, it is essential to develop systems that can identify semantic similarity between texts, as they can recognize when texts communicate the same ideas.

hits.text_i: This approach can more accurately identify plagiarism and help uphold academic integrity.
hits.text_j: Such an approach can catch plagiarism more accurately and help uphold academic integrity.
